page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY-1
page.content: The name {Oxhill}is derived from "Othan Scylf" or "Ohtas Hill" and is pronounced today "Ocs-shull" and is mentioned in the Doomesday Book.It had several manors and one was combined with Whatcote before the Normans by Toli.The chief manor was taken by the Normans and afterwards passed through many families including the De Keynes, the Catesbys,(of Gunpowder Plot fame), and the Owens after the Battle of Bosworth.The Monks of Bordesley also owned land in Oxhill. The site of the village of Idlicote has changed twice,probably due to the plague.The name is thought to come from cottages,(cote), for pensioners, (idle).The church is Norman.A field on Idlicote Hill is called Hospital Field probably from the{Battle of Edgehill.}
